title: Charges dismissed for Aaron Dunnings, arrested in murder of 3-year-old Major Howard
content:
CLEVELAND - Charges against the man arrested earlier this month in connection with the murder of 3-year-old Major Howard have been dismissed.
Court documents show charges were dismissed Tuesday against 23-year-old Aaron Dunnings.
The Cuyahoga County Prosecutor's Office said the investigation into Major's murder continues and the office has decided not to seek an indictment for Dunnings at this time. Dunnings will now go to Ashtabula County to face felony drug trafficking charges.
Cleveland police announced on Jan. 12 that Dunnings had been apprehended by the Northern Ohio Violent Fugitives Task Force. He was charged with aggravated murder.
Major was shot in the chest in a drive-by shooting while sitting in car on East 113th Street in September. He later died at the hospital.
Major was just one of the multiple children under 15 who were shot and killed in Cleveland last year.
Police are still looking for 23-year-old Donnell Lindsey in connection with the murder.
